intro: Grangea bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored grangea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking bi-colored flowers, which typically feature a combination of white and purple hues. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its showy, trumpet-shaped blooms. Grangea bicolor thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to flourish. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
